restaurants.name: J. Hollinger's Waterman's Chophouse
restaurants.description: Restaurateur Jerry Hollinger delivered to downtown Silver Spring an Art Deco-styled American chophouse and raw bar celebrating local farmers, watermen, and purveyors. Menu highlights include shrimp and pork belly toast, Rohan duck confit, homemade spinach ricotta ravioli, and a luxe lineup of steaks with add-ons like butter-poached crab and lobster.

restaurants.name: Aventino Cucina
restaurants.description: One of Mike Friedman’s newest spots in Bethesda, Aventino Cucina evokes the culinary traditions of Rome and Italy’s Lazio region with airy pizza rossa, light salads like agrumi, and fantastic house-made pastas including cacio e pepe and all’amatriciana. The sprawling emerald- and gold-covered dining room pairs spritzes with pasta and offers desserts like chocolate torte with blood orange gelato.

restaurants.name: Cielo Rojo
restaurants.description: The Takoma Park favorite for vegan-friendly Mexican fare turns out hand-pressed tortillas made with nixtamalized heirloom corn for sophisticated tacos, ahi tuna tostadas, and enchiladas with tres moles. The chic bar sends out inventive mezcal and rum-based cocktails, and brunch specialties include mezcal mascarpone brioche French toast and chilaquiles rojo.

restaurants.name: 2Fifty Texas BBQ (Multiple locations)
restaurants.description: Riverdale Park’s drive-worthy brisket destination pays homage to Central Texas with oak-smoked meats from Fernando González and Debby Portillo, offering brisket, beef ribs, pulled pork, and daily specials like brisket tacos and barbecue pupusas. The operation expanded with a sit-down smokehouse in Mt. Vernon Triangle and also offers preorder pickup.

restaurants.name: Thip Khao
restaurants.description: Considered the standard-bearer for Lao cuisine in D.C., Thip Khao serves a menu full of fermented fish sauce, chiles, offal, and cured meats from mother-and-son chefs Seng Luangrath and Boby Pradachith. Hit orders include crispy tamarind-glazed wings, grilled pork shoulder with lemongrass, and a fiery Lao papaya salad.

restaurants.name: Purple Patch
restaurants.description: Mount Pleasant’s upscale local Filipino restaurant is known for sizzling sisig, longanisa, tocino, and surprisingly satisfying vegetarian dishes like calamansi tofu with pineapple fried rice and several vegetarian adobos. The small indoor space and covered patio make it a neighborhood institution celebrated for ube desserts and creative brunch offerings.

restaurants.name: Perry's Restaurant
restaurants.description: The revitalized Adams Morgan restaurant, overseen by chef Masako Morishita, is earning attention for flavorful Japanese creations including a Japanese-style ceviche, crispy karaage, and garlic edamame dumplings under a snowy parmesan blanket. The sleek wood-framed dining room also hosts one of D.C.’s best drag brunches and a strong sake collection.

restaurants.name: Elmina
restaurants.description: Eric Adjepong’s brick-and-mortar showcases modern spins on traditional West African and Ghanaian dishes like fufu and kelewele alongside new interpretations like spicy cassava udon noodles and egusi hummus. Situated on 14th Street NW, the two-story restaurant offers a full dining room, cocktails with regional flavors, and a casual takeout counter called Dawa inside.

restaurants.name: Ceibo
restaurants.description: Brothers Juan and Manuel Olivera opened a candle-lit Adams Morgan getaway paying homage to Uruguay and its surrounding countries, focusing on asado-style grilling of meats and seafood like oysters with Uruguayan caviar and Patagonian shrimp. The two-level space features a dimly lit downstairs bar spotlighting South American wines and an intimate dining room.

restaurants.name: Bresca
restaurants.description: Chef Ryan Ratino’s buzzy bistro on lower 14th Street serves inventive New American dinners — from yellowtail crudo to cacio e pepe and an adored Amish chicken — and offers tasting menus as well as a la carte and prix fixe options. The restaurant uses theatrical touches like a vintage French duck press for tableside service and a notable bar program.

restaurants.name: Anju
restaurants.description: Anju serves refined Korean bar food between Dupont Circle and Adams Morgan, with standouts such as pork and kimchi mandu, gochujang-glazed fried chicken, seafood fried rice, and seared rib-eye galbi boards. Weekend brunches add playful items like a smash galbi burger and gochujang chicken with corn cheese waffle.

restaurants.name: Joon
restaurants.description: Joon in Tysons Corner offers upscale takes on Iranian cuisine from cookbook author and executive chef Najmieh Batmanglij and chef-owner Christopher Morgan, with dishes like pistachio soup and braised lamb shoulder alongside a beautiful lounge, May Bar. The restaurant has earned wide acclaim and hosts Live Fire Fridays during warmer months.

restaurants.name: SURA Restaurant
restaurants.description: A family-run underground lounge in Dupont led by former sushi chef Billy Thammasathiti, SURA brings bold Thai flavors like quail egg wontons, fiery papaya salads, boneless duck laap, and spicy skewers, paired with passionfruit daiquiris and Sichuan baijiu cocktails at a red-lit bar. The 50-seat lair opens in the early evening and emphasizes adventurous plates.

restaurants.name: Amparo Fondita
restaurants.description: Chef Christian Irabién’s Dupont restaurant is an ode to modern Mexican cuisine and his roots, blending coastal flavors and seasonal local ingredients into dishes like soft-shell crab sandwich with red onion-habanero escabeche and expertly engineered mole negro. The constantly changing menu features ceviches, mezcal-friendly oysters, and nixtamalized masa cakes.

restaurants.name: Oyster Oyster
restaurants.description: Chef Rob Rubba’s vegetable-forward, Michelin-starred Shaw restaurant prioritizes hyperlocal sourcing and offers vegetarian or vegan tasting menus, with inventive preparations such as fried celery root nests and smoked tofu. The intimate 28-seat dining room focuses on sustainably minded practices and creative plating.

restaurants.name: Shia
restaurants.description: Shia is a nonprofit hidden tasting-menu restaurant from Edward Lee focused on sustainable alternatives, all-electric cookware, and zero-plastic operations while producing cutting-edge Korean tasting menus in an open-kitchen setting. The prix fixe options showcase dishes like black sesame guksu with caviar, seared black grouper, and mustard-glazed duck, with rare soju and sake available.

restaurants.name: Tabard Inn
restaurants.description: The century-old boutique hotel’s dining room, refreshed under culinary partner Ian Boden, serves French-Southern–influenced dishes that highlight mid-Atlantic ingredients, from crab fritters and local oysters to duck confit and bone-in Berkshire pork chop. The dining room benefits from an outdoor garden and an eclectic bar program with rotating rare bottles.

restaurants.name: Causa/Amazonia
restaurants.description: Causa is an ambitious, Michelin-starred fine-dining Peruvian prix fixe in Blagden Alley that sends diners on a seafaring voyage through Peruvian coastline and Andean flavors, while Amazonia above offers a more casual, color-soaked counterpart with skewers and tropical vibes. Causa’s intimate format and six-course menus create an immersive experience.

restaurants.name: Unconventional Diner
restaurants.description: Chef David Deshaies applies classic French technique to American diner staples next to the convention center, producing elevated dishes like haute meatloaf, mini-pot pie poppers, chicken and waffles, and apple pie French toast. The swanky diner’s bright booths and illuminated bar make for a playful, approachable atmosphere with daily brunch and dinner.

restaurants.name: L’Avant-Garde
restaurants.description: Sébastien Giannini’s Georgetown showpiece channels French Riviera–style seafood cooking with saffron bouillabaisse, branzino, filet mignon, lobster-and-grapefruit salad, and King crab tartare, all served in an ultra-chic Parisian-styled dining room. The hands-on chef emphasizes refined, seafood-centric plates and a four-course lobster tasting menu.

restaurants.name: Kyojin Sushi
restaurants.description: The team behind Yume Sushi opened this flashy Georgetown sushi cave serving truffle wasabi, monkfish liver, uni with torched wagyu, and imaginative rolls alongside hot izakaya-style offerings. The striking raw-fish–forward spot features a scene-y bar with rotating DJs and late-night cocktails.

restaurants.name: Imperfecto
restaurants.description: Enrique Limardo’s follow-up to Seven Reasons is an avant-garde West End restaurant blending Mediterranean and Latin influences with modernist technique and wood-burning hearth cooking. The rotating tasting or a la carte menus feature dramatic plates like fried Spanish octopus and surreal presentations, and the restaurant has a Michelin star.

restaurants.name: Casa Teresa
restaurants.description: Spanish chef Rubén García’s flagship in The Square brings live-fire cooking and family-style Spanish feasts with grilled whole fish, vegetables, and pass-the-plate meats prepared over oak charcoal. The terracotta-toned dining room centers on gins, vermouth, and Spanish wines and includes an intimate Teresa’s Table for tastings.

restaurants.name: Cucina Morini
restaurants.description: The Mt. Vernon Triangle Italian outpost from Altamarea Group offers fresh crudo, small plates, fish soup, and homemade pastas in half or whole portions along with a reimagined aperitivo bar and stylish dining room. The menu celebrates Southern Italian flavors and includes weekend cornettos by Matt Adler.

restaurants.name: Baan Siam
restaurants.description: Chef Jeeraporn Poksupthon’s roomy Mt. Vernon Triangle restaurant highlights Northern and Northeastern Thai cooking with khao soi, tapioca skin dumplings, and ultra-spicy curries from the south, while also offering desserts like mini coconut milk pancakes and mango sticky rice when in season. The large kitchen and ambitious menu showcase the chef’s skills in authentic Thai flavors.

restaurants.name: Tapori
restaurants.description: From the team behind Daru, Tapori is a vibrant H Street restaurant centered on South Indian and Nepalese street foods with dishes like pani puri, vada pav, dosas, and a paneer-based “chop,” plus cocktails made with spices and fruits like chaat masala and jackfruit. The space was fully overhauled to include a 20-person communal table and a bright open kitchen.

restaurants.name: Centrolina
restaurants.description: Amy Brandwein’s polished osteria in CityCenter DC focuses on seasonally driven Italian dishes, from melon-flanked snapper sashimi and pristine pastas to wood-fired mains like halibut and lamb rib-eye. The frequently changing menu emphasizes peak produce and refined Italian cooking techniques.

restaurants.name: Tonari
restaurants.description: Katsuya Fukushima’s wafu restaurant in Chinatown brings a Japanese spin to pizza and pasta with thick square pies made from Hokkaido wheat flour and inventive pasta dishes, including Japanese-influenced cheesesteaks as a monthly special. The two-floor restaurant features a spacious downstairs bar and ties to nearby ramen and izakaya concepts.

restaurants.name: Moon Rabbit by Kevin Tien
restaurants.description: Kevin Tien’s fine-dining Vietnamese restaurant returned to Penn Quarter with contemporary Vietnamese dishes like koji-marinated cumin lamb, perilla-stuffed wagyu, and soft dinner rolls from a celebrated pastry chef. The refreshed location pairs inventive cocktails with refined Vietnamese cuisine and plans for an adjacent cocktail room and bakery.

restaurants.name: The Occidental
restaurants.description: Stephen Starr resurrected the iconic downtown Occidental two blocks from the White House as a glamorous, midcentury-American restaurant serving tableside martinis, caviar, prime rib, lamb chops with mint jelly, lobster, and classic starters. The two-story venue revives white-tablecloth hospitality with classic, decadent American fare.

restaurants.name: Pascual
restaurants.description: Isabel Coss and Matt Conroy’s Capitol Hill restaurant honors Mexico City and hearth-focused cooking with smoked chicken, whole grilled fish, and tamales, alongside roasted vegetables and Oaxacan flavors like mole. The seasonal, hearth-forward menu has earned the spot acclaim including Eater’s Best New Restaurants in America.

restaurants.name: SER Restaurant
restaurants.description: A decade-old Ballston Spanish stalwart, Ser offers an extensive tapas list including tomato bread, croquetas, and deep-fried eggplant, plus seafood, meat, and vegetable paellas and dramatic menu items like whole roast suckling pig. The restaurant emphasizes Spanish flavors and a convivial dining experience with an expanded patio.

restaurants.name: Dōgon
restaurants.description: Kwame Onwuachi’s Afro-Caribbean restaurant at the Salamander Washington DC explores Nigerian, Jamaican, Trinidadian, and Creole heritage with dishes like barbecue greens, plantain hoe cakes, carrot tigua, and a signature ‘H Street’ chicken and rice. The menu celebrates bold flavors and includes standout items like coco bread with malted sorghum butter.

restaurants.name: Ama
restaurants.description: Navy Yard’s elegant Italian eatery from Micah Wilder and Johanna Hellrigl transitions from a Genovese-style focacceria by day into an aperitivo bar and convivial restaurant by night, serving Tuscan salami, fennel salads, rabbit stew, spaghetti al pomodoro, and gelato. The morning cafè bancone component offers coffee and pastries starting at 8 a.m.

restaurants.name: Fish Shop
restaurants.description: The UK seafood shop Fish Shop opened at the Wharf serving hyperlocal seafood dishes like crab-topped crumpets, Tall Timbers oysters grilled with ’nduja brown butter, and roasted rockfish, paired with scenic Southwest Waterfront views and nautical decor. The Bib Gourmand–designated fishmonger concept focuses on stellar seafood and group-friendly private dining rooms.

restaurants.name: Albi
restaurants.description: Michael Rafidi’s high-end Palestinian restaurant spotlights wood-burning hearth cooking and Levantine flavors, from crab hummus to lamb meat pies with toum, alongside inventive cocktails, desserts, and a new five-course Sofra menu. The restaurant emphasizes smoke, peak produce, and Eastern Mediterranean wines.

restaurants.name: Shilling Canning Company
restaurants.description: Chef Reid Shilling’s Navy Yard restaurant and raw bar highlights mid-Atlantic ingredients with a preservation-minded approach, offering seasonal dishes like Chesapeake rockfish, squash blossoms from the on-site garden, and a seven-course tasting option. The restaurant credits its dairy, oyster, cattle, and produce purveyors and showcases preserved goods on display.

restaurants.name: Mama Chang
restaurants.description: Peter Chang’s home-style Chinese restaurant pays tribute to the women who influenced the chef, offering fiery Sichuan and Hunan dishes that recall his childhood in Hubei, with menu highlights including dim sum, vegetable-heavy plates, and scallion bubble pancakes. The plant-filled dining room serves family-style orders in a casual setting.
